title: Normal node aware that a folder has been (manually) deleted from the Normal node folder, but Master node not aware. No Out of Sync / Override changes on Master!

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
Hello,

**Scenario**,

**Host PC**
Folder set to Master, No File Versioning, Compression off.
**Destination PC**
Folder set to Normal, No File Versioning, Compression off.
**Other**
Both PCs are connected successfully over LAN and have been syncing OK. Both PCs have remained successfully connected throughout testing. 

**Test 1**
1. Manually added an additional folder (via Explorer) in the Destination PCs backup folder.
2. This was detected on the Host PC and the changes were then manually overridden via the Host PCs GUI.
3. This is the expected behaviour.

**Test 2**
1. Manually deleted one of the folders (via Explorer) in the Destination PCs backup folder (note the .stfolder file was not deleted).
2. The Destination PC GUI reported that the Remote Device (the Host) was Syncing 95%. All other status on both PCs reported as Up To Date. The deleted folder on the Destination PC has not been re-synced.
3. The .exe on the Destination PC was restarted. The Destination PC GUI reported that the Remote Device (the Host) was Syncing 95%. All other status on both PCs reported as Up To Date. The deleted folder on the Destination PC has not been re-synced.
4. The .exe on the Host PC was restarted. All status on both PCs reported as Up To Date. The deleted folder on the Destination PC has not been re-synced.
5. Both PCs were re-booted and the .exe restarted. The Destination PC GUI reported that the Remote Device (the Host) was Syncing 95% (and has remained 95%). All other status on both PCs reported as Up To Date. The deleted folder on the Destination PC has not been re-synced.

**What I expected to happen**
The manually deleted folder on the Destination PC should have been re-synced from the Host PC as the Host PC has the Master folder.  
### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.14.6, Windows (64 bit) 
OS Version: Windows 10 Home 64bit.
